ACT
44
JOINT AND SEVERAL OBLIGATIONS OF SPOUSES
Both spouses are jointly and severally liable for the obligations assumed by one spouse in order to meet the current needs of the marital and family union, as well as for the obligations committed jointly by the spouses in connection with the matrimonial property.
If, in order to settle joint obligations, from the co-ownership part of the matrimonial property or from the own property of one spouse, more than his share of the debt is charged, that spouse has the right to compensation of that amount from his part of the matrimonial property, i.e. from his own property.
Spouses are considered to be equally responsible for the obligations referred to in paragraph 1 of this article, unless they have agreed otherwise.
